name: Magic Chocolate Chip Cookies
description: A 7 layer bar, but in cookie form. They're rich, decadent, heavy on the chocolate, extra gooey...and magical!

recipe_ingredient.note: 2 sticks (1 cup) salted butter, at room temperature
recipe_ingredient.display: 2 sticks (1 cup) salted butter, at room temperature

recipe_ingredient.note: 3/4 cup light or dark brown sugar
recipe_ingredient.display: 3/4 cup light or dark brown sugar

recipe_ingredient.note: 1 1/2 cups chopped chocolate chunks or chips
recipe_ingredient.display: 1 1/2 cups chopped chocolate chunks or chips

recipe_ingredient.note: 1 cup sweetened or unsweetened coconut flakes
recipe_ingredient.display: 1 cup sweetened or unsweetened coconut flakes

recipe_ingredient.note: 1/2 cup roasted peanuts (or any other toasted nut)
recipe_ingredient.display: 1/2 cup roasted peanuts (or any other toasted nut)

recipe_instructions.text: Preheat the oven to 350Â° F. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper. Place 1 stick of butter in a large mixing bowl and set aside.

Add 1 stick of butter to a small saucepan set over medium heat. Cook until the butter begins to brown, about 3-4 minutes. Remove from the heat and pour the butter over the stick of butter in the mixing bowl. Stick in the freezer to chill, 10-15 minutes, but no longer. The butter should be chilled, but mostly melted.

To the mixing bowl, add the brown sugar and vanilla, beat until combined. Beat in the eggs, 1 at a time, until combined. Add the flour, baking soda, and salt. Fold in the chocolate chips, coconut, and peanuts. Drizzle over the sweetened condensed milk and mix until lightly combined, you should see streaks of condensed milk.

Let the dough sit 5 minutes, then roll the dough into 2 tablespoon size balls and place 3 inches apart on the prepared baking sheet. Gently flatten each ball down into a disk using the palm of your hand.

Transfer to the oven and bake for 7 minutes. Remove the pan from the oven and tap the baking sheet on the counter 2 times to flatten them down. Return to the oven and bake another 3-4 minutes or until the cookies begin to set on the edges, but still doughy in the center. Remove from the oven and tap the baking sheet on the counter 1-2 times to flatten them down again. Let the cookies cool on the baking sheet. They will continue to cook slightly as they sit on the baking sheet. Eat warm (highly recommend) or let cool and store in an airtight container for up to 4 days.
